headline.print_headline: Law’s Side Effect: Putting School Budgets on a Diet, Too
headline.main: Law’s Side Effect: Putting School Budgets on a Diet, Too
Law's Side Effect: Putting School Budgets on a Diet, Too

docs.abstract: New school nutrition law in Connecticut, aimed at addressing problem of obesity by restricting sale of some drinks and snack foods, is having adverse effect on income of some school districts; students who used to make such purchases at school stores now buy them outside; photo (M)
docs.section_name: Health; Education; New York and Region
docs.lead_paragraph: IT takes effort for Adam Drenkard to get a ginger ale these days. Adam, a tall, lanky 17-year-old senior, used to stop at the high school store for his daily soda before marching-band practice. But since Connecticut's new school nutrition law went into effect before the start of the school year, he has to drive to a nearby gas station. ''I get 15 or 16 sodas sometimes just for kids here,'' he said, noting that that money no longer goes to the school and its activities.

headline.print_headline: New Diet Drug Is Approved With Pudgy Dogs in Mind
headline.main: New Diet Drug Is Approved for Pudgy Dogs

docs.lead_paragraph: The F.D.A. announced its approval of the first prescription drug to treat obesity in dogs.
docs.snippet: The F.D.A. announced its approval of the first prescription drug to treat obesity in dogs.

headline.print_headline: What’s Making Us Sick Is an Epidemic of Diagnoses
headline.main: What’s Making Us Sick Is an Epidemic of Diagnoses

byline.original: By H. GILBERT WELCH, LISA SCHWARTZ and STEVEN WOLOSHIN

docs.lead_paragraph: For most Americans, the biggest health threat is not avian flu, West Nile or mad cow disease. It’s our health-care system.
docs.snippet: For most Americans, the biggest health threat is not avian flu, West Nile or mad cow disease. It’s our health-care system.

headline.main: What's Making Us Sick Is an Epidemic of Diagnoses

byline.original: This article is by H. Gilbert Welch, Lisa Schwartz and Steven Woloshin

docs.abstract: Drs H Gilbert Welch, Lisa Schwartz and Steven Woloshin Essay discusses medical climate in United States that they hold finds people to be ill much more often than healthy; says there is epidemic of diagnoses; drawing (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: For most Americans, the biggest health threat is not avian flu, West Nile or mad cow disease. It's our health-care system. You might think this is because doctors make mistakes (we do make mistakes). But you can't be a victim of medical error if you are not in the system. The larger threat posed by American medicine is that more and more of us are being drawn into the system not because of an epidemic of disease, but because of an epidemic of diagnoses.
